Desc: Conflict between Rome and Avignon line of popes
Causes: Papal election of Urban VI leading to two popes, one in Rome and one in Avignon
Consequences: Resulted in papal claimants throughout Europe; conflict between the two papal claimants; disputes over doctrine and power between nations and their respective popes
Outcomes: Events ending with Council of Constance and the Avignon line recognized
Significance: Reassertion of papal authority and exercise of papal power; reformation of the papal system
